news.title: Study examines legacies of rainforest burning in British Columbia
news.summary: Analyses of temperate rain forests located on the central coast of British Columbia, Canada suggest that for centuries, humans have intentionally used fire to manage plant-life.

news.title: Study Examines Legacies of Rain Forest Burning in British Columbia
news.summary: The findings are published in the Journal of Biogeography. When researchers reconstructed 700 years of temporal and spatial aspects of fire activity, they recorded 16 fires from 1376-1893.

news.title: Study Examines Legacies of Rain Forest Burning in British Columbia
news.summary: Printer friendly versionShare 25 September 2017 Wiley Analyses of temperate rain forests located on the central coast of British Columbia, Canada suggest that for centuries, humans have intentionally used fire to manage plant-life.
